eta.discourseÔÉÅ

Tools for storing and processing discourse in Eta dialogues.

Functions

compress

Replace auxiliary-NOT combinations by -N'T contractions.

decompress

Expand contractions into full phrases (e.g.

get_prior_turn

Retrieve the immediately prior turn by the specified agent(s).

parse_utt_str

Parse an utterance string into a word string and affect.

presubst

Prepare a string for calling the swap_duals function to avoid ungrammatical substitutions.

swap_duals

Swap first-person pronouns (I, me, ...) with second-person pronouns (you, ...), and vice-versa.

Classes

DialogueTurn

Represents a dialogue turn by an agent, which contains the utterance as well as any associated dialogue information.

Utterance

Represents a single utterance, which contains both the words of the utterance and an affect.
class Utterance(words, affect='neutral')[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Represents a single utterance, which contains both the words of the utterance and an affect.

The content of the utterance.

Type:

str

affectÔÉÅ

The affect of the utterance. Must be contained within the list of supported emotions (default is ‚Äòneutral‚Äô).

Type:

str, optional

Represents a dialogue turn by an agent, which contains the utterance as well as any associated dialogue information.

get_prior_turn(turns, agent=None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Retrieve the immediately prior turn by the specified agent(s).

Parameters:

  • turns (list[DialogueTurn]) ‚Äì A list of dialogue turns in the conversation, in chronological order.

  • agent (str, optional) ‚Äì The agent whose prior turn should be found (by default, find the prior turn by any agent).

Returns:

The prior turn by the given agent (if one exists).

Return type:

DialogueTurn or None

parse_utt_str(str)[source]ÔÉÅ

Parse an utterance string into a word string and affect.

Parameters:

str (str) ‚Äì A string representing an utterance, potentially prefixed by an emotion tag, e.g., [happy] or [sad].

Returns:

  • affect (str) ‚Äì The affect/emotion of the utterance.

  • words (str) ‚Äì The word string of the utterance.

compress(str)[source]ÔÉÅ

Replace auxiliary-NOT combinations by -N‚ÄôT contractions.

presubst(str)[source]ÔÉÅ

Prepare a string for calling the swap_duals function to avoid ungrammatical substitutions.

For example, in swapping dual pronouns, we want to avoid outputs such as ‚Äúwhy do you say i are stupid‚Äù, while still correctly producing ‚Äúwhy do you say your brothers are stupid‚Äù.

This function replaces ‚Äúare‚Äù by ‚Äúare2‚Äù when preceded or followed by ‚Äúyou‚Äù; similarly, it replaces

‚Äúwere‚Äù by ‚Äúwere2‚Äù and ‚Äúwas‚Äù by ‚Äúwas2‚Äù.

It also replaces ‚Äúyou‚Äù by ‚Äúyou2‚Äù when it is the last word, or when it is not one of the first two words and is not preceded by certain conjunctions (‚Äúand‚Äù, ‚Äúor‚Äù, ‚Äúbut‚Äù, ‚Äúthat‚Äù, ‚Äúbecause‚Äù, ‚Äúif‚Äù, ‚Äúwhen‚Äù, ‚Äúthen‚Äù, ‚Äúwhy‚Äù, ‚Ä¶), or certain subordinating verbs (‚Äúthink‚Äù, ‚Äúbelieve‚Äù, ‚Äúknow‚Äù, ‚Ä¶), or when it follows ‚Äúto‚Äù.

This is in preparation for replacement of ‚Äúyou2‚Äù by ‚Äúme‚Äù (rather than ‚Äúi‚Äù) when swap_duals is applied.

swap_duals(str)[source]ÔÉÅ

Swap first-person pronouns (I, me, ‚Ä¶) with second-person pronouns (you, ‚Ä¶), and vice-versa.
